title: Pest Control
description: Comprehensive pest control requirements for indoor agriculture including written policies, effective pest control programs, documentation, monitoring devices, building integrity, and pest-proofing measures

requirements.text: Is there a written policy prohibiting animals in the facility, including the growing areas and any packaging or equipment storage areas?
mandatoryStatements: Written policy prohibits all animals in the facility
Policy covers growing areas, storage areas, and production zones
Policy applies to both wild and domestic animals
Policy is communicated to all personnel
Policy enforcement procedures are established
Exceptions (if any) are clearly defined and controlled
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of animal prohibition policy, quarterly verification of policy communication and enforcement
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily monitoring for animal presence, immediate enforcement of animal prohibition policy

requirements.text: Is there an effective pest control program in place? A ZERO POINT (NON-CONFORMANCE) DOWNSCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THE AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Comprehensive pest control program is established and implemented
Program addresses all relevant pest types for indoor agriculture
Program includes prevention, monitoring, and control measures
Program is demonstrably effective (no pest infestations)
Program is appropriate for indoor agriculture environment
Program is reviewed and updated regularly
Records demonstrate program implementation and effectiveness
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification of pest control program effectiveness, annual program review
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of pest activity, continuous implementation of pest control measures

requirements.text: Is the pest control program properly documented, detailing the scope of the program, target pests and frequency of checks, including a copy of the contract with the extermination company (if used), Pest Control Operator license(s)/training (if baits are used), and insurance documents?
mandatoryStatements: Pest control program documentation includes program scope
Target pests for the indoor agriculture operation are identified
Inspection and monitoring frequency is documented
Contract with pest control company on file (if external service used)
Pest Control Operator licenses/certifications on file (if baits used)
Insurance documentation for pest control services on file
Training records for in-house pest control personnel
All documentation is current and accessible
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of all pest control documentation currency and completeness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly review of pest control documentation, immediate update when changes occur

requirements.text: Is there a schematic drawing/plan of the indoor agriculture operation, showing numbered locations of all pest monitoring devices (e.g., rodent traps, bait stations, insect light traps, etc.) both inside and outside the facility?
mandatoryStatements: Schematic drawing/plan of facility exists for pest control
All pest monitoring device locations are shown on plan
Each device location is numbered or uniquely identified
Plan shows both interior and exterior device locations
Plan is current and reflects actual device placement
Plan is updated when devices are added, moved, or removed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification that pest control map matches actual device locations, update within 30 days of changes
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly comparison of map to actual device placement, immediate update for device changes

requirements.text: Are service reports created for pest control checks detailing inspection records, application records, and corrective actions of issues noted (in-house and/or contract)?
mandatoryStatements: Service reports are created for all pest control checks
Reports detail inspection findings for each device location
Reports document any pesticide or bait applications
Reports identify pest activity or issues found
Reports document corrective actions taken for any issues
Reports are maintained for both in-house and contract services
Reports are signed and dated by responsible person
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of pest control service reports for completeness and follow-up
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Review of each service report upon receipt, verification that corrective actions are completed

requirements.text: Are closed doors, and windows to the outside pest proof?
mandatoryStatements: Doors to outside are pest-proof when closed
Windows to outside are pest-proof (sealed or screened)
Door seals and sweeps are intact and functional
No gaps or openings allow pest entry
Screens (if used) are intact without holes or tears
Self-closing mechanisms function properly on exterior doors
Regular inspection and maintenance of pest-proofing measures
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of all exterior doors and windows for pest-proofing integrity
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly checks of door and window pest-proofing, immediate repair of gaps or damage

requirements.text: Is the area outside the facility free of evidence of pest activity?
mandatoryStatements: Exterior area around facility shows no evidence of pest activity
No rodent burrows, tracks, or droppings outside facility
No insect nesting or breeding sites in exterior areas
Exterior conditions do not attract or harbor pests
Vegetation and debris management prevents pest harborage
Regular inspection of exterior areas for pest activity
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of facility exterior for pest activity evidence
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily visual checks of exterior perimeter, immediate response to pest activity signs

requirements.text: Are pest control devices located away from exposed raw materials (e.g., seeds, transplants, soil, media), finished goods and packaging, and poisonous bait stations are not used within the facility?
mandatoryStatements: Pest control devices are not placed near exposed raw materials
Devices are located away from finished goods and product
Devices are positioned away from packaging materials
Poisonous bait stations are not used inside the facility
Device placement prevents contamination risk
Only appropriate device types are used in product areas
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification of pest control device placement appropriateness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly checks of device locations, immediate relocation if contamination risk identified

requirements.text: Are pest control devices maintained in a clean and intact condition and marked as monitored (or bar code scanned) on a regular basis?
mandatoryStatements: All pest control devices are maintained clean
Devices are intact and functional
Devices are marked or tagged when monitored
Date of last monitoring is visible on device or in system
Barcode scanning system used (if applicable)
Regular monitoring schedule is followed
Damaged devices are repaired or replaced promptly
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly verification that all devices are monitored according to schedule
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly or bi-weekly monitoring of all pest control devices per schedule

requirements.text: Are interior and exterior building perimeter pest control devices adequate in number and location?
mandatoryStatements: Sufficient number of pest control devices for facility size
Devices are strategically located for maximum effectiveness
All potential pest entry points are covered
Interior devices provide adequate coverage of sensitive areas
Exterior perimeter has appropriate device spacing
Device placement follows industry best practices
Device adequacy is reviewed and adjusted as needed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of device adequacy and placement, adjustment when facility changes occur
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly assessment of pest control coverage, immediate addition of devices if gaps identified

requirements.text: Are all pest control devices identified by a number or other code (e.g., barcode)?
mandatoryStatements: Every pest control device has a unique identifier
Identification number or code is clearly visible on device
Device IDs match those on facility pest control map
Device identification system is consistent throughout facility
Barcode or other tracking system used (if applicable)
Device IDs are recorded in monitoring records
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification that all devices are properly identified and match documentation
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly check that device identifications are visible and accurate

requirements.text: Are all pest control devices effective and bait stations secured?
mandatoryStatements: All pest control devices are functioning effectively
Bait stations are securely anchored or locked
Devices are appropriate for target pests
Devices are in good working condition
Bait stations cannot be easily moved or opened by unauthorized persons
Device effectiveness is verified through monitoring results
Ineffective devices are replaced or adjusted
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification of device effectiveness and bait station security
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly checks of device functionality and security, immediate repair or replacement of ineffective devices

capaInject: If no animal prohibition policy: develop and implement policy within 7 days, communicate to all personnel immediately
If pest control program ineffective: immediate enhanced monitoring, engage pest control expert within 48 hours, implement remedial measures within 7 days
If pest control documentation incomplete: complete all required documentation within 14 days, verify licenses and insurance are current
If pest control map inaccurate: update map within 7 days, verify all device locations
If service reports incomplete: immediately complete current reports, implement reporting checklist to ensure completeness
If doors or windows not pest-proof: immediate temporary sealing, permanent repair within 14 days
If exterior pest activity detected: immediate pest control measures, enhanced monitoring, eliminate harborage within 7 days
If device placement creates contamination risk: immediately relocate devices, review and adjust placement plan
If devices not monitored per schedule: immediate monitoring of all devices, retrain personnel within 7 days
If bait stations not secured: immediately secure all stations, verify security of all devices within 24 hours
traceabilityInject: Pest control service reports must be traceable to specific dates, device locations, and service personnel
Pest control device monitoring must be traceable to specific devices, dates, and findings
Any pest activity must be documented with traceability to locations, dates, and corrective actions
Pest control contractor activities must be traceable through service reports and documentation
